title: Approximate distance queries and compact routing in sparse graphs.
abstract: An approximate distance query data structure is a compact representation of a graph, and can be queried to approximate shortest paths between any pair of vertices. Any such data structure that retrieves stretch 2k Ω 1 paths must require space Ω(n 1+1/k ) for graphs of n nodes. The hard cases that enforce this lower bound are, however, rather dense graphs with average degree Ω(n 1/k ).
